content:
Hi, I am trying to put on the subject 2 References, Patient and BiollogicallyDerivedProduct using the syntaxis * subject only Reference (Patient or BiollogicallyDerivedProduct) and I get an error. I have tested with all the possible subject Reference values and when seeing the list, all elements starting from Organization throw the same error: The type "Reference(Organization)" does not match any of the allowed types: Reference(http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient | http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Group | http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Device | http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Location)
image.png
It only works for Patient, Group, Device and Location.
I have put all elements on FshOnline so you can see it yourself https://fshschool.org/FSHOnline/#/share/3JViAol

In your example you have Organization added to the list, but Organization does not match the restrictions from Observation.

If I put there what you wrote: * subject only Reference(Patient or BiologicallyDerivedProduct), FSH School throws an error as it doesn't know BiologicallyDerivedProduct.

Right Mareike, my error is an example, sushi is throwing an error of the type "Reference(x)" doesn't match any of the allowed types where x is any allowed Resource except Patient, Group, Device or Location. I changed the type from BiollogicallyDerivedProduct to Organization to test and I had the error that I copied. The right error for my problem is The type "Reference(BiologicallyDerivedProduct)" does not match any of the allowed types: Reference(http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient | http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Group | http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Device | http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Location)
Yes, that's because FSH School does not know what a BiologicallyDerivedProduct is.
but is a viable Reference according to the standard image.png

Thanks for the reply, I started getting a little bit confused...
Hope you got your answer. Greetings and happy new year.
Diana_Ovelgoenne has marked this topic as resolved.
